meanings.definition: allowing light to pass through; translucent
meanings.sent1: The curtains were so diaphanous that the sunlight easily shone through them.
meanings.sent2: She wore a diaphanous scarf that fluttered in the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The diaphanous fabric was so sheer, it almost looked like magic!
meanings.sent4: Her diaphanous dress seemed to float around her like a cloud.
meanings.sent5: The lake sparkled through the diaphanous water lilies.

meanings.sent1: The delicate wings of the butterfly were diaphanous in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The diaphanous fabric of her dress caught the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent3: The diaphanous clouds in the sky looked like fluffy cotton candy.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as diaphanous and joyful as a summer breeze.
meanings.sent5: The diaphanous petals of the flower seemed to glow in the moonlight.
